title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement CINTESIS. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Calculate the Grantham Distance
text: goal grantham provide minimal set routines calculate Grantham distance1. Grantham distance attempts provide proxy evolutionary distance two amino acids based three key side chain chemical properties: composition, polarity molecular volume. turn, evolutionary distance used proxy impact missense substitutions. higher distance, deleterious substitution expected .

title: Calculate the Grantham Distance
text: can install development version grantham like :

title: Calculate the Grantham Distance
text: Grantham distance two amino acids: function grantham_distance() vectorised amino acids matched element-wise form pairs comparison: two vectors amino acids must compatible sizes sense vec_recycle() element recycling possible, .e., either two vectors length, one length one, recycled length . Use function amino_acid_pairs() generate 20 x 20 amino acid pairs: now calculate Grantham distances pairs aa_pairs: distances symmetric, pairs formed amino acid trivially zero, might want exclude pairs: Grantham distance di, j two amino acids j : di, j = ρ(α(ci−cj)2+β(pi−pj)2+γ(vi−vj)2)1/2 . distance based three chemical properties amino acid side chains: composition (c) polarity (p) molecular volume (v) provide data set properties: want calculate Grantham distance property values may use function grantham_equation().
code: library(grantham)  grantham_distance(x = 'Ser', y = 'Phe') #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   x     y         d #>   <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 Ser   Phe     155 grantham_distance(x = c('Ser', 'Arg'), y = c('Phe', 'Leu')) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   x     y         d #>   <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 Ser   Phe     155 #> 2 Arg   Leu     102 # `'Ser'` is recycled to match the length of the second vector, i.e. 3. grantham_distance(x = 'Ser', y = c('Phe', 'Leu', 'Arg')) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   x     y         d #>   <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 Ser   Phe     155 #> 2 Ser   Leu     145 #> 3 Ser   Arg     110 aa_pairs <- amino_acid_pairs() aa_pairs #> # A tibble: 400 × 2 #>    x     y     #>    <chr> <chr> #>  1 Ser   Ser   #>  2 Ser   Arg   #>  3 Ser   Leu   #>  4 Ser   Pro   #>  5 Ser   Thr   #>  6 Ser   Ala   #>  7 Ser   Val   #>  8 Ser   Gly   #>  9 Ser   Ile   #> 10 Ser   Phe   #> # … with 390 more rows grantham_distance(x = aa_pairs$x, y = aa_pairs$y) #> # A tibble: 400 × 3 #>    x     y         d #>    <chr> <chr> <dbl> #>  1 Ser   Ser       0 #>  2 Ser   Arg     110 #>  3 Ser   Leu     145 #>  4 Ser   Pro      74 #>  5 Ser   Thr      58 #>  6 Ser   Ala      99 #>  7 Ser   Val     124 #>  8 Ser   Gly      56 #>  9 Ser   Ile     142 #> 10 Ser   Phe     155 #> # … with 390 more rows # `keep_self = FALSE`: excludes pairs such as ("Ser", "Ser") # `keep_reverses = FALSE`: excludes reversed pairs, e.g. ("Arg", "Ser") will be # removed because ("Ser", "Arg") already exists. aa_pairs <- amino_acid_pairs(keep_self = FALSE, keep_reverses = FALSE)  # These amino acid pairs are the 190 pairs shown in Table 2 of Grantham's # original publication. aa_pairs #> # A tibble: 190 × 2 #>    x     y     #>    <chr> <chr> #>  1 Ser   Arg   #>  2 Ser   Leu   #>  3 Ser   Pro   #>  4 Ser   Thr   #>  5 Ser   Ala   #>  6 Ser   Val   #>  7 Ser   Gly   #>  8 Ser   Ile   #>  9 Ser   Phe   #> 10 Ser   Tyr   #> # … with 180 more rows  # Grantham distance for the 190 unique amino acid pairs grantham_distance(x = aa_pairs$x, y = aa_pairs$y) #> # A tibble: 190 × 3 #>    x     y         d #>    <chr> <chr> <dbl> #>  1 Ser   Arg     110 #>  2 Ser   Leu     145 #>  3 Ser   Pro      74 #>  4 Ser   Thr      58 #>  5 Ser   Ala      99 #>  6 Ser   Val     124 #>  7 Ser   Gly      56 #>  8 Ser   Ile     142 #>  9 Ser   Phe     155 #> 10 Ser   Tyr     144 #> # … with 180 more rows amino_acids_properties #> # A tibble: 20 × 4 #>    amino_acid     c     p     v #>    <chr>      <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Ser         1.42   9.2  32   #>  2 Arg         0.65  10.5 124   #>  3 Leu         0      4.9 111   #>  4 Pro         0.39   8    32.5 #>  5 Thr         0.71   8.6  61   #>  6 Ala         0      8.1  31   #>  7 Val         0      5.9  84   #>  8 Gly         0.74   9     3   #>  9 Ile         0      5.2 111   #> 10 Phe         0      5.2 132   #> 11 Tyr         0.2    6.2 136   #> 12 Cys         2.75   5.5  55   #> 13 His         0.58  10.4  96   #> 14 Gln         0.89  10.5  85   #> 15 Asn         1.33  11.6  56   #> 16 Lys         0.33  11.3 119   #> 17 Asp         1.38  13    54   #> 18 Glu         0.92  12.3  83   #> 19 Met         0      5.7 105   #> 20 Trp         0.13   5.4 170

title: Calculate the Grantham Distance
text: sources ’ve found R ecosystem also provide code calculation Grantham distance: GitHub Gist Daniel E Cook provides function calculate_grantham(), see Fetch_Grantham.R. {midasHLA} package includes unexported function distGrantham() utils.R. {HLAdivR} package exports data set Grantham distances format matrix, see data.R.

title: Calculate the Grantham Distance
text: Please note grantham package released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Calculate the Grantham Distance
text: 1. Grantham, R. Amino acid difference formula help explain protein evolution. Science 185, 862–864 (1974). doi: 10.1126/science.185.4154.862.

title: Generate amino acid pairs — amino_acid_pairs
text: function generates combinations amino acids pairs. default, generates pair combinations 20 standard amino acids.

title: Generate amino acid pairs — amino_acid_pairs
code: amino_acid_pairs(   x = amino_acids(),   y = amino_acids(),   keep_self = TRUE,   keep_duplicates = TRUE,   keep_reverses = TRUE )

title: Generate amino acid pairs — amino_acid_pairs
text: x character vector amino acids (three-letter codes). y Another character vector amino acids (three-letter codes). keep_self Whether keep pairs involving amino acid. keep_duplicates Whether keep duplicated pairs. keep_reverses Whether keep pairs reversed versions others. E.g. keep_reverses TRUE pairs "Ser"-"Arg" "Arg"-"Ser" kept returned tibble; however, keep_reverses FALSE, first pair preserved output.

title: Generate amino acid pairs — amino_acid_pairs
text: tibble amino acid pairs.

title: Generate amino acid pairs — amino_acid_pairs
code: # Generate all pairs of the 20 standard amino acids amino_acid_pairs() #> # A tibble: 400 × 2 #>    x     y     #>    <chr> <chr> #>  1 Ser   Ser   #>  2 Ser   Arg   #>  3 Ser   Leu   #>  4 Ser   Pro   #>  5 Ser   Thr   #>  6 Ser   Ala   #>  7 Ser   Val   #>  8 Ser   Gly   #>  9 Ser   Ile   #> 10 Ser   Phe   #> # … with 390 more rows  # Remove the self-to-self pairs amino_acid_pairs(keep_self = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 380 × 2 #>    x     y     #>    <chr> <chr> #>  1 Ser   Arg   #>  2 Ser   Leu   #>  3 Ser   Pro   #>  4 Ser   Thr   #>  5 Ser   Ala   #>  6 Ser   Val   #>  7 Ser   Gly   #>  8 Ser   Ile   #>  9 Ser   Phe   #> 10 Ser   Tyr   #> # … with 370 more rows  # Generate specific combinations of Ser against Ala and Trp. amino_acid_pairs(x = 'Ser', y = c('Ala', 'Trp')) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   x     y     #>   <chr> <chr> #> 1 Ser   Ala   #> 2 Ser   Trp

title: The 20 standard amino acids — amino_acids
text: 20 amino acids encoded directly codons universal genetic code.

title: The 20 standard amino acids — amino_acids
text: Three-letter codes standard amino acids.

grantham: Calculate the 'Grantham' Distance — grantham-package
text: minimal set routines calculate 'Grantham' distance <doi:10.1126/science.185.4154.862>. 'Grantham' distance attempts provide proxy evolutionary distance two amino acids based three key chemical properties: composition, polarity molecular volume. turn, evolutionary distance used proxy impact missense mutations. higher distance, deleterious substitution expected .

title: grantham: Calculate the 'Grantham' Distance — grantham-package
text: Maintainer: Ramiro Magno ramiro.magno@gmail.com (ORCID) Authors: Isabel Duarte iduarte.scientist@gmail.com (ORCID) Ana-Teresa Maia maia.anateresa@gmail.com (ORCID) contributors: CINTESIS [copyright holder, funder]

title: Grantham distance — grantham_distance
text: function calculates Grantham distance pairs amino acids. Amino acid identities provided three-letter codes x y. Amino acids identified x y matched element-wise, .e. first element x paired first element y, . Grantham distance attempts provide proxy evolutionary distance two amino acids based three key chemical properties: composition, polarity molecular volume. turn, evolutionary distance used proxy impact missense substitutions. higher distance, deleterious substitution . distance calculation provided two methods. -called original method, meaning amino acid distances used ones provided Grantham original publication Table 2. default method. addition, may choose exact method, uses chemical properties provided Grantham's Table 1 compute amino acid differences anew. distances calculated exact method rounded nearest integer differ ~1 unit amino acid pairs original method. want calculate Grantham's distance providing values amino acid properties explicitly, use grantham_equation() instead.

title: Grantham distance — grantham_distance
code: grantham_distance(   x,   y,   method = c("original", "exact"),   alpha = 1.833,   beta = 0.1018,   gamma = 0.000399,   rho = 50.723 )

title: Grantham distance — grantham_distance
text: x character vector amino acid three-letter codes. y character vector amino acid three-letter codes. method Either "original" (default) "exact", see description details. alpha constant \(\alpha\) equation Grantham's paper, page 863. beta constant \(\beta\) equation Grantham's paper, page 863. gamma constant \(\gamma\) equation Grantham's paper, page 863. rho Grantham's distances reported Table 2, Science (1974). 185(4154): 862--4 R. Grantham, scaled factor (named \(\rho\)) mean value distances 100. rho parameter allows factor \(\rho\) changed. default \(\rho=50.723\), value used Grantham. value originally mentioned caption Table 2 aforementioned paper.

title: Grantham distance — grantham_distance
text: tibble Grantham's distances amino acid pair.

title: Grantham distance — grantham_distance
code: # Grantham's distance between Serine (Ser) and Glutamate (Glu) grantham_distance('Ser', 'Glu') #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   x     y         d #>   <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 Ser   Glu      80  # Grantham's distance between Serine (Ser) and Glutamate (Glu) # with the "exact" method grantham_distance('Ser', 'Glu', method = 'exact') #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   x     y         d #>   <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 Ser   Glu    79.8  # `grantham_distance()` is vectorised # amino acids are paired element-wise between `x` and `y` grantham_distance(x = c('Pro', 'Gly'), y = c('Glu', 'Arg')) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   x     y         d #>   <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 Pro   Glu      93 #> 2 Gly   Arg     125  # Use `amino_acid_pairs()` to generate pairs (by default generates all pairs) aa_pairs <- amino_acid_pairs() grantham_distance(x = aa_pairs$x, y = aa_pairs$y) #> # A tibble: 400 × 3 #>    x     y         d #>    <chr> <chr> <dbl> #>  1 Ser   Ser       0 #>  2 Ser   Arg     110 #>  3 Ser   Leu     145 #>  4 Ser   Pro      74 #>  5 Ser   Thr      58 #>  6 Ser   Ala      99 #>  7 Ser   Val     124 #>  8 Ser   Gly      56 #>  9 Ser   Ile     142 #> 10 Ser   Phe     155 #> # … with 390 more rows

title: Grantham's distance (exact) — grantham_distance_exact
text: function calculates Grantham's distance pairs amino acids. uses values amino acid properties published Table 1 Science (1974). 185(4154): 862--4 R. Grantham.

title: Grantham's distance (exact) — grantham_distance_exact
code: grantham_distance_exact(   x,   y,   alpha = 1.833,   beta = 0.1018,   gamma = 0.000399,   rho = 50.723 )

title: Grantham's distance (exact) — grantham_distance_exact
text: x character vector amino acid three-letter codes, e.g. "Ala" (Alanine). y character vector amino acid three-letter codes. alpha constant \(\alpha\) equation Grantham's paper, page 863. beta constant \(\beta\) equation Grantham's paper, page 863. gamma constant \(\gamma\) equation Grantham's paper, page 863. rho Grantham's distances reported Table 2, Science (1974). 185(4154): 862--4 R. Grantham, scaled factor (named \(\rho\)) mean value distances 100. rho parameter allows factor \(\rho\) changed. default \(\rho=50.723\), value used Grantham. value originally mentioned caption Table 2 aforementioned paper.

title: Grantham's distance (exact) — grantham_distance_exact
text: tibble Grantham's distances amino acid pair.

title: Grantham's distance (exact) — grantham_distance_exact
text: Contrary Grantham's distances presented Table 2 Grantham's paper, distances returned function calculated anew starting amino acid properties (composition, polarity molecular volume). rounding nearest integer performed.

title: Grantham's distance (exact) — grantham_distance_exact
code: grantham_distance_exact(c('Ser', 'Ser'), c('Pro', 'Trp')) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   x     y         d #>   <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 Ser   Pro    73.4 #> 2 Ser   Trp   177.

title: Grantham's distance (original) — grantham_distance_original
text: function calculates Grantham's distance pairs amino acids. uses pre-calculated distances amino acid pair published Table 2 Science (1974). 185(4154): 862--4 R. Grantham.

title: Grantham's distance (original) — grantham_distance_original
text: x character vector amino acid three-letter codes. y character vector amino acid three-letter codes.

title: Grantham's distance (original) — grantham_distance_original
text: tibble Grantham's distances amino acid pair.

title: Grantham distance matrix — grantham_distances_matrix
text: dataset containing Grantham distances format matrix. values obtained Table 2,  Grantham (1974), doi: 10.1126/science.185.4154.862 .

title: Grantham distance matrix — grantham_distances_matrix
text: object class matrix (inherits array) 20 rows 20 columns.

title: Grantham distance matrix — grantham_distances_matrix
text: Table 2,  Grantham (1974), doi: 10.1126/science.185.4154.862 .

title: Grantham distance — grantham_equation
text: function calculates Grantham's distance \(d_{,j}\) two amino acids (\(\) \(j\)) based chemical properties: $$d_{,j} = \rho ((\alpha (c_i-c_j)^2 + \beta (p_i-p_j)^2 + \gamma (v_i-v_j)^2)^\frac{1}{2}$$ calculation based three amino acid side chain properties found three strongest correlators relative substitution frequency (RSF) (references cited Grantham (1974)), namely: composition \(c\), meaning atomic weight ratio hetero (noncarbon) elements end groups rings carbons side chain. polarity \(p\); molecular volume \(v\). property difference weighted dividing mean distance found alone formula. constants \(\alpha\), \(\beta\) \(\gamma\) squares inverses mean distances property, respectively. distances reported Grantham (1972) scaled factor ---coined \(\rho\)--- mean distances 100. Although factor explicitly included Grantham's distance formula, actually used calculating amino acid pair distances reported Table 2 Grantham's paper. , intents purposes, factor regarded part formula used calculate Grantham distance, therefore include explicitly equation . want calculate Grantham's distance right identity amino acids, instead using chemical properties, use grantham_distance().

title: Grantham distance — grantham_equation
code: grantham_equation(   c_i,   c_j,   p_i,   p_j,   v_i,   v_j,   alpha = 1.833,   beta = 0.1018,   gamma = 0.000399,   rho = 50.723 )

title: Grantham distance — grantham_equation
text: c_i composition value ith amino acid. c_j composition value jth amino acid. p_i polarity value ith amino acid. p_j polarity value jth amino acid. v_i molecular volume value ith amino acid. v_j molecular volume value jth amino acid. alpha constant \(\alpha\) equation Grantham's paper, page 863. beta constant \(\beta\) equation Grantham's paper, page 863. gamma constant \(\gamma\) equation Grantham's paper, page 863. rho Grantham's distances reported Table 2, Science (1974). 185(4154): 862--4 R. Grantham, scaled factor (named \(\rho\)) mean value distances 100. rho parameter allows factor \(\rho\) changed. default \(\rho=50.723\), value used Grantham. value originally mentioned caption Table 2 aforementioned paper.

title: Grantham distance — grantham_equation
text: double vector Grantham's distances.
